intro: Dimorphotheca annua, commonly known as the star flower or yellow starburry, is an annual flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with a central disk and radiating petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Dimorphotheca annua is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
